	Limited Partner in the Partnership, which may be evidenced by Common Units, Subordinated Units, Incentive Distribution Rights or other Partnership Interests (other than a General Partner Interest) or a combination thereof (but excluding Derivative
	Partnership Interests), and includes any and all benefits to which such Limited Partner is entitled as provided in this Agreement, together with all obligations of such Limited Partner pursuant to the terms and provisions of this Agreement.
<B>
</B>
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX; TEXT-INDENT:4%">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" SIZE="2">
<B>
</B>
	&#147;
<B>
	Liquidation Date
</B>
	&#148; means (a)&nbsp;in the case of an event giving rise to the dissolution of the
	Partnership of the type described in
<U>
	clauses (a)
</U>
	&nbsp;and
<U>
	(d)
</U>
	&nbsp;of the third sentence of
<U>
	Section&nbsp;12.1
</U>
	, the date on which the applicable time period during which the holders of Outstanding Units have the right to elect to
	continue the business of the Partnership has expired without such an election being made and (b)&nbsp;in the case of any other event giving rise to the dissolution of the Partnership, the date on which such event occurs.
<B>
</B>
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX; TEXT-INDENT:4%">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" SIZE="2">
<B>
</B>
	&#147;
<B>
	Liquidation Gain
</B>
	&#148; has the meaning set forth in the definition of Net Termination Gain.
<B>
</B>
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX; TEXT-INDENT:4%">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" SIZE="2">
<B>
</B>
	&#147;
<B>
	Liquidation Loss
</B>
	&#148; has the meaning set forth in the definition of Net Termination Loss.
<B>
</B>
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX; TEXT-INDENT:4%">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" SIZE="2">
	&#147;
<B>
	Liquidator
</B>
	&#148; means one or more Persons selected pursuant to
<U>
	Section&nbsp;12.3
</U>
	to perform the functions described
	in
<U>
	Section&nbsp;12.4
</U>
	as liquidating trustee of the Partnership within the meaning of the Delaware Act.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX; TEXT-INDENT:4%">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" SIZE="2">
<B>
</B>
	&#147;
<B>
	Maintenance Capital Expenditure
</B>
	&#148; means cash expenditures (including expenditures for the construction of new
	capital assets or the replacement, improvement or expansion of existing capital assets) by a Group Member made to maintain, over the long term, the operating capacity or operating income of the Partnership Group. Maintenance Capital Expenditures
	shall not include Expansion Capital Expenditures or Investment Capital Expenditures. Maintenance Capital Expenditures shall include interest (and related fees) on Construction Debt to fund the replacement assets and paid in respect of the
	Construction Period and the amount of cash distributions paid in respect of Construction Equity to fund the construction or development of replacement assets (and incremental Incentive Distributions in respect thereof) and paid in respect of the
	Construction Period. For purposes of this definition, &#147;long term&#148; generally refers to a period of time greater than twelve months.
<B>
</B>
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX; TEXT-INDENT:4%">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" SIZE="2">
<B>
</B>
	&#147;
<B>
	Merger Agreement
</B>
	&#148; has the meaning given such term in
<U>
	Section 14.1
</U>
	.
<B>
</B>
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX">
<FONT SIZE="1">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>

<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX; TEXT-INDENT:4%">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" SIZE="2">
	&#147;
<B>
	Minimum Quarterly Distribution
</B>
	&#148; means $0.3750 per Unit per Quarter (or
	with respect to the period commencing on the Closing Date and ending on September 30, 2016, it means the product of $0.3750 multiplied by a fraction, the numerator of which is the number of days in such period and the denominator of which is 92),
	subject to adjustment in accordance with
<U>
	Section&nbsp;5.10
</U>
	,
<U>
	Section&nbsp;6.6
</U>
	and
<U>
	Section&nbsp;6.9
</U>
	.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX; TEXT-INDENT:4%">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" SIZE="2">
<B>
</B>
	&#147;
<B>
	National Securities Exchange
</B>
	&#148; means an exchange registered with the Commission under Section&nbsp;6(a) of the
	Exchange Act (or any successor to such Section).
<B>
</B>
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX; TEXT-INDENT:4%">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" SIZE="2">
<B>
</B>
	&#147;
<B>
	NBL Midstream
</B>
	&#148; has the meaning given such
	term in the preamble.
<B>
</B>
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX; TEXT-INDENT:4%">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" SIZE="2">
	&#147;
<B>
	Net Agreed Value
</B>
	&#148; means (a)&nbsp;in the case of any Contributed Property, the
	Agreed Value of such Contributed Property reduced by any Liabilities either assumed by the Partnership upon such contribution or to which such Contributed Property is subject when contributed and (b)&nbsp;in the case of any property distributed to a
	Partner by the Partnership, the Partnership&#146;s Carrying Value of such property (as adjusted pursuant to
<U>
	Section&nbsp;5.4(d)(ii))
</U>
	at the time such property is distributed, reduced by any Liabilities either assumed by such Partner upon such
	distribution or to which such property is subject at the time of distribution.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX; TEXT-INDENT:4%">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" SIZE="2">
<I>
</I>
	&#147;
<I>
</I>
<B>
	Net
	Income
</B>
<I>
</I>
	&#148; means, for any taxable period, the excess, if any, of the Partnership&#146;s items of income and gain (other than those items taken into account in the computation of Net Termination Gain or Net Termination Loss) for such
	taxable period over the Partnership&#146;s items of loss and deduction (other than those items taken into account in the computation of Net Termination Gain or Net Termination Loss) for such taxable period. The items included in the calculation of
	Net Income shall be determined in accordance with
<U>
	Section&nbsp;5.4
</U>
	and shall not include any items specially allocated under
<U>
	Section&nbsp;6.1(d)
</U>
	;
<I>
	provided, however
</I>
	, that the determination of the items that have been specially
	allocated under
<U>
	Section&nbsp;6.1(d)
</U>
	shall be made without regard to any reversal of such items under
<U>
	Section 6.1(d)(xii)
</U>
	.
<I>
</I>
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX; TEXT-INDENT:4%">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" SIZE="2">
<B>
</B>
	&#147;
<B>
	Net Loss
</B>
	&#148; means, for any taxable period, the excess, if any, of the Partnership&#146;s items of loss and deduction (other than those items taken into account in the computation of
	Net Termination Gain or Net Termination Loss) for such taxable period over the Partnership&#146;s items of income and gain (other than those items taken into account in the computation of Net Termination Gain or Net Termination Loss) for such
	taxable
<B>
</B>
	period. The items included in the
<B>
</B>
	calculation of Net Loss shall be determined in accordance with
<U>
	Section&nbsp;5.4
</U>
	and shall not include any items specially allocated under
<U>
	Section&nbsp;6.1(d)
</U>
	;
<I>
	provided,
	however
</I>
	, that the determination of the items that have been specially allocated under
<U>
	Section&nbsp;6.1(d)
</U>
	shall be made without regard to any reversal of such items under
<U>
	Section&nbsp;6.1(d)(xii)
</U>
	.
<B>
</B>
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX; TEXT-INDENT:4%">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" SIZE="2">
<B>
</B>
	&#147;
<B>
	Net Positive Adjustments
</B>
	&#148; means, with respect to any Partner, the excess, if any, of the total positive
	adjustments over the total negative adjustments made to the Capital Account of such Partner pursuant to Book-Up Events and Book-Down Events.
<B>
</B>
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX; TEXT-INDENT:4%">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" SIZE="2">
<B>
</B>
	&#147;
<B>
	Net Termination Gain
</B>
	&#148; means, as applicable, (a)&nbsp;the sum, if positive, of all items of income, gain, loss or deduction (determined in accordance with
<U>
	Section&nbsp;5.4
</U>
	(b)) that are recognized (i)&nbsp;after the Liquidation Date (&#147;
<B>
</B>
<B>
<I>
	Liquidation Gain
</I>
</B>
<B>
</B>
	&#148;) or (ii)&nbsp;upon the sale, exchange or other disposition of all or substantially all of the assets of the
	Partnership Group, taken as a whole, in a single transaction or a series of related transactions (excluding any disposition to a member of the Partnership Group) (&#147;
<B>
</B>
<B>
<I>
	Sale Gain
</I>
</B>
<B>
</B>
	&#148;), or (b)&nbsp;the excess, if any, of
	the aggregate amount of Unrealized Gain over the aggregate amount of Unrealized Loss deemed recognized by the Partnership pursuant to
<U>
	Section&nbsp;5.4(d)
</U>
	on the date of a Revaluation Event (&#147;
<B>
</B>
<B>
<I>
	Revaluation
	Gain
</I>
</B>
<B>
</B>
	&#148;);
<B>
</B>
<I>
	provided, however
</I>
<B>
</B>
	, the items included in the determination of Net Termination Gain shall not include any items of income, gain or loss specially allocated under
<U>
	Section&nbsp;6.1(d)
</U>
	; and
<B>
</B>
<I>
	provided, further
</I>
<B>
</B>
	, that Sale Gain and Revaluation Gain shall not include any items of income, gain, loss or deduction that are recognized during any portion of the taxable period during which such Sale Gain or Revaluation Gain
	occurs.
<B>
</B>
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX">
<FONT SIZE="1">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>

<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" SIZE="2">
<B>
</B>
	&#147;
<B>
	Net Termination Loss
</B>
	&#148; means, as applicable, (a)&nbsp;the sum, if
	negative, of all items of income, gain, loss or deduction (determined in accordance with
<U>
	Section&nbsp;5.4
</U>
	(b)) that are recognized (i)&nbsp;after the Liquidation Date (&#147;
<B>
</B>
<B>
<I>
	Liquidation Loss
</I>
</B>
<B>
</B>
	&#148;) or (ii)&nbsp;upon
	the sale, exchange or other disposition of all or substantially all of the assets of
<B>
</B>
	the Partnership Group, taken as a whole, in a single transaction or a series of related transactions (excluding any disposition to a member of the
	Partnership Group) (&#147;
<B>
</B>
<B>
<I>
	Sale Loss
</I>
</B>
<B>
</B>
	&#148;), or (b)the excess, if any, of the aggregate amount of Unrealized Loss over the aggregate amount of Unrealized Gain deemed recognized by the Partnership pursuant to
<U>
	Section&nbsp;5.4(d)
</U>
	on the date of a Revaluation Event (&#147;
<B>
</B>
<B>
<I>
	Revaluation Loss
</I>
</B>
<B>
</B>
	&#148;);
<B>
</B>
<I>
	provided, however
</I>
<B>
</B>
	, items included in the determination of Net Termination Loss shall not include any items
	of income, gain or loss specially allocated under
<U>
	Section&nbsp;6.1(d)
</U>
	; and
<B>
</B>
<I>
	provided, further
</I>
<B>
</B>
	, that Sale Loss and Revaluation Loss shall not include any items of income, gain, loss or deduction that are recognized during
	any portion of the taxable period during which such Sale Loss or Revaluation Loss occurs.
<B>
</B>
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX; TEXT-INDENT:4%">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" SIZE="2">
<B>
</B>
	&#147;
<B>
	Noble
</B>
	&#148; means Noble Energy, Inc., a Delaware corporation.
<B>
</B>
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX; TEXT-INDENT:4%">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" SIZE="2">
<B>
</B>
	&#147;
<B>
	Noncompensatory Option
</B>
	&#148; has the meaning set forth in Treasury Regulation
<FONT STYLE="WHITE-SPACE:NOWRAP">
	Section&nbsp;1.721-2(f).
</FONT>
<B>
</B>
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX; TEXT-INDENT:4%">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" SIZE="2">
<B>
</B>
	&#147;
<B>
	Nonrecourse Built-in Gain
</B>
	&#148;
	means with respect to any Contributed Properties or Adjusted Properties that are subject to a mortgage or pledge securing a Nonrecourse Liability, the amount of any taxable gain that would be allocated to the Partners pursuant to
<U>
	Section&nbsp;6.2(b)
</U>
	if such properties were disposed of in a taxable transaction in full satisfaction of such liabilities and for no other consideration.
<B>
</B>
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX; TEXT-INDENT:4%">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" SIZE="2">
<B>
</B>
	&#147;
<B>
	Nonrecourse Deductions
</B>
	&#148; means any and all items of loss, deduction or expenditure (including any expenditure described in Section&nbsp;705(a)(2)(B) of the Code) that, in
	accordance with the principles of Treasury Regulation Section&nbsp;1.704-2(b), are attributable to a Nonrecourse Liability.
<B>
</B>
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX; TEXT-INDENT:4%">

	&#148; has the meaning set forth in Treasury Regulation
<FONT STYLE="WHITE-SPACE:NOWRAP">
	Section&nbsp;1.752-1(a)(2).
</FONT>
<B>
</B>
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX; TEXT-INDENT:4%">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" SIZE="2">
	&#147;
<B>
	Notice
</B>
	&#148; means a written request from a Holder pursuant to
<U>
	Section&nbsp;7.12
</U>
	which shall (a)&nbsp;specify the
	Registrable Securities intended to be registered, offered and sold by such Holder, (b)&nbsp;describe the nature or method of the proposed offer and sale of Registrable Securities and (c)&nbsp;contain the undertaking of such Holder to provide all
	such information and materials and take all action as may be required or appropriate in order to permit the Partnership to comply with all applicable requirements and obligations in connection with the registration and disposition of such
	Registrable Securities pursuant to
<U>
	Section&nbsp;7.12
</U>
	.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX; TEXT-INDENT:4%">

</B>
	&#147;
<B>
	Omnibus Agreement
</B>
	&#148; means that certain
	Omnibus Agreement, effective as of the Closing Date, among Noble, the Organizational Limited Partner, NBL Midstream, the General Partner, the Partnership and the other Persons party thereto from time to time, as such agreement may be amended,
	supplemented or restated from time to time.
<B>
</B>
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX; TEXT-INDENT:4%">

</B>

<B>
	Operational Services and Secondment Agreement
</B>
	&#148;
	means that certain Operational Services and Secondment Agreement, effective as of the Closing Date, among Noble, the Partnership, the General Partner and the other Persons party thereto from time to time, as such agreement may be amended,
	supplemented or restated from time to time.
<B>
</B>
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX; TEXT-INDENT:4%">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" SIZE="2">
<B>
</B>
	&#147;
<B>
	Operating Expenditures
</B>
	&#148; means all Partnership
	Group cash expenditures (or the Partnership&#146;s proportionate share of expenditures in the case of Subsidiaries that are not wholly owned), including taxes, compensation of employees, officers and directors of the General Partner, reimbursement
	of expenses of the General Partner and its Affiliates, debt service payments, Estimated Maintenance Capital Expenditures, repayment of Working Capital Borrowings and payments made in the ordinary course of business under any Hedge Contracts, subject
	to the following:
<B>
</B>
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:6PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX; TEXT-INDENT:4%">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" SIZE="2">
	(a) repayments of Working Capital Borrowings deducted from Operating Surplus pursuant to
<U>
	clause
	(b)(iii)
</U>
	of the definition of &#147;Operating Surplus&#148; shall not constitute Operating Expenditures when actually repaid;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX">
<FONT SIZE="1">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX" ALIGN="CENTER">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" SIZE="2">
	A-13
</FONT>
</P>
<A NAME="eolPage302"></A>
<P STYLE='PAGE-BREAK-BEFORE:ALWAYS'>
<HR SIZE="3" STYLE="COLOR:#999999" WIDTH="100%" ALIGN="CENTER">
<H5 ALIGN="LEFT">
<A HREF="#D164220DS1A_HTM_TOC">
	Table of Contents
</A>
</H5>
<H5 ALIGN="LEFT">
<A HREF="#D164220DS1A_HTM_INDEX">
	Index to Financial Statements
</A>
</H5>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX; TEXT-INDENT:4%">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" SIZE="2">
	(b) payments (including prepayments and prepayment penalties) of principal of and premium on
	indebtedness other than Working Capital Borrowings shall not constitute Operating Expenditures;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX; TEXT-INDENT:4%">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" SIZE="2">
	(c) Operating Expenditures
	shall not include (i)&nbsp;Expansion Capital Expenditures, (ii)&nbsp;actual Maintenance Capital Expenditures, (iii)&nbsp;Investment Capital Expenditures, (iv)&nbsp;payment of transaction expenses (including taxes) relating to Interim Capital
	Transactions, (v)&nbsp;distributions to Partners, (vi)&nbsp;repurchases of Partnership Interests, other than repurchases of Partnership Interests by the Partnership to satisfy obligations under employee benefit plans or reimbursement of expenses of
	the General Partner for purchases of Partnership Interests by the General Partner to satisfy obligations under employee benefit plans or (vii)&nbsp;any other expenditures or payments using the proceeds of the Initial Public Offering as described
	under &#147;Use of Proceeds&#148; in the IPO Prospectus. Where cash expenditures are made in part for Maintenance Capital Expenditures and in part for other purposes, the General Partner shall determine the allocation between the amounts paid for
	each; and
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX; TEXT-INDENT:4%">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" SIZE="2">
	(d) (i) amounts paid in connection with the initial purchase of a Hedge Contract shall be amortized over the life
	of such Hedge Contract and (ii)&nbsp;payments made in connection with the termination of any Hedge Contract prior to the expiration of its scheduled settlement or termination date shall be included in equal quarterly installments over the remaining
	scheduled life of such Hedge Contract.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX; TEXT-INDENT:4%">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" SIZE="2">
<B>
</B>
	&#147;
<B>
	Operating Surplus
</B>
	&#148; means, with respect to any period ending
	prior to the Liquidation Date, on a cumulative basis and without duplication,
<B>
</B>
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX; TEXT-INDENT:4%">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" SIZE="2">
<I>
</I>
	(a) the sum of (i)&nbsp;$45.0
	million, (ii)&nbsp;all cash receipts of the Partnership Group (or the Partnership&#146;s proportionate share of cash receipts in the case of Subsidiaries that are not wholly owned) for the period beginning on the Closing Date and ending on the last
	day of such period, but excluding cash receipts from Interim Capital Transactions and the termination of Hedge Contracts (provided that cash receipts from the termination of a Hedge Contract prior to its scheduled settlement or termination date
	shall be included in Operating Surplus in equal quarterly installments over the remaining scheduled life of such Hedge Contract), (iii)&nbsp;all cash receipts of the Partnership Group (or the Partnership&#146;s proportionate share of cash receipts
	in the case of Subsidiaries that are not wholly owned) after the end of such period but on or before the date of determination of Operating Surplus with respect to such period resulting from Working Capital Borrowings and (iv)&nbsp;the amount of
	cash distributions from Operating Surplus paid during the Construction Period (including incremental Incentive Distributions) on Construction Equity to fund Expansion Capital Expenditures,
<I>
	less
</I>
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX; TEXT-INDENT:4%">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" SIZE="2">
<I>
</I>
	(b) the sum of (i)&nbsp;Operating Expenditures for the period beginning on the Closing Date and ending on the last day of such
	period, (ii)&nbsp;the amount of cash reserves (or the Partnership&#146;s proportionate share of cash reserves in the case of Subsidiaries that are not wholly owned) established by the General Partner to provide funds for future Operating
	Expenditures; (iii)&nbsp;all Working Capital Borrowings not repaid within twelve months after having been incurred, or repaid within such 12-month period with the proceeds of additional Working Capital Borrowings and (iv)&nbsp;any cash loss realized
	on disposition of an Investment Capital Expenditure;
<I>
	provided, however
</I>
	, that disbursements made (including contributions to a Group Member or disbursements on behalf of a Group Member) or cash reserves established, increased or reduced after
	the end of such period but on or before the date of determination of Available Cash with respect to such period shall be deemed to have been made, established, increased or reduced, for purposes of determining Operating Surplus, within such period
	if the General Partner so determines.
<I>
</I>
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX; TEXT-INDENT:4%">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" SIZE="2">
	Notwithstanding the foregoing, (x)&nbsp;&#147;Operating Surplus&#148; with
	respect to the Quarter in which the Liquidation Date occurs and any subsequent Quarter shall equal zero; (y)&nbsp;cash receipts from an Investment Capital Expenditure shall be treated as cash receipts only to the extent they are a return on
	principal, but in no event shall a return of principal be treated as cash receipts; and (z)&nbsp;cash received from any equity interest in a Person that is not a Subsidiary of a Group Member and for which the Partnership accounts using the equity
	method shall not exceed the Partnership&#146;s proportionate share of the Person&#146;s Operating Surplus (calculated as if the pertinent definitions hereof applied to such Person from the date the Partnership acquired its interest without any
	basket similar to clause (a)(i) above).
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX">
<FONT SIZE="1">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX" ALIGN="CENTER">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" SIZE="2">
	A-14
</FONT>
</P>

	means Noble Midstream Services, LLC, a Delaware limited liability company.

	Interest

</B>
	&#148; has
	the meaning given such term in Section 5.1.

</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX; TEXT-INDENT:4%">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" SIZE="2">
	&#147;
<B>
	Outstanding
</B>
	&#148; means, with respect to Partnership Interests, all
	Partnership Interests that are issued by the Partnership and reflected as outstanding in the Partnership Register as of the date of determination;
<I>
	provided, however
</I>
	, that if at any time any Person or Group (other than the General Partner or
	its Affiliates) beneficially owns 20% or more of the Outstanding Partnership Interests of any class, all Partnership Interests owned by or for the benefit of such Person or Group shall not be entitled to be voted on any matter and shall not be
	considered to be Outstanding when sending notices of a meeting of Limited Partners to vote on any matter (unless otherwise required by law), calculating required votes, determining the presence of a quorum or for other similar purposes under this
	Agreement, except that Partnership Interests so owned shall be considered to be Outstanding for purposes of
<U>
	Section&nbsp;11.1(b)(iv)
</U>
	(such Partnership Interests shall not, however, be treated as a separate class or group of Partnership
	Interests for purposes of this Agreement or the Delaware Act);
<I>
	provided, further
</I>
	, that the foregoing limitation shall not apply to (i)&nbsp;any Person or Group who acquired 20% or more of the Outstanding Partnership Interests of any class
	directly from the General Partner or its Affiliates (other than the Partnership), (ii)&nbsp;any Person or Group who acquired 20% or more of the Outstanding Partnership Interests of any class directly or indirectly from a Person or Group described in
<U>
	clause (i)
</U>
	,
<I>
	provided
</I>
	, that, upon or prior to such acquisition, the General Partner shall have notified such Person or Group in writing that such limitation shall not apply, or (iii)&nbsp;any Person or Group who acquired 20% or more of
	any Partnership Interests issued by the Partnership with the prior approval of the Board of Directors.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX; TEXT-INDENT:4%">

<B>
</B>
	&#147;
<B>
	Partnership Register
</B>
	&#148; means a register maintained on behalf of the
	Partnership by the General Partner, or, if the General Partner so determines, by the Transfer Agent as part of the Transfer Agent&#146;s books and transfer
<B>
</B>
	records, with respect to each class of Partnership Interests in which all Record
	Holders and transfers of such class of Partnership Interests are registered or otherwise recorded.
<B>
</B>
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX; TEXT-INDENT:4%">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" SIZE="2">
<B>
</B>
	&#147;
<B>
	Per Unit Capital Amount
</B>
	&#148; means, as of any date of determination, the Capital Account, stated on a per Unit
	basis, underlying any Unit held by a Person other than the General Partner or any Affiliate of the General Partner who holds Units.
<B>
</B>
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX; TEXT-INDENT:4%">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" SIZE="2">
<B>
</B>
	&#147;
<B>
	Percentage Interest
</B>
	&#148; means, as of any date of determination, (a)&nbsp;as to any Unitholder with respect to Units, the product obtained by multiplying (i)&nbsp;100% less the
	percentage applicable to
<U>
	clause (b)
</U>
	&nbsp;below by (ii)&nbsp;the quotient obtained by dividing (A)&nbsp;the number of Units held by such Unitholder by (B)&nbsp;the total number of Outstanding Units, and (b)&nbsp;as to the holders of other
	Partnership Interests issued by the Partnership in accordance with
<U>
	Section&nbsp;5.5
</U>
	, the percentage calculated in accordance with the method established as a part of such issuance. The Percentage Interest with respect to an Incentive
	Distribution Right and the General Partner Interest, in each case, shall at all times be zero.
<B>
</B>
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX; TEXT-INDENT:4%">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" SIZE="2">
<B>
</B>
	&#147;
<B>
	Person
</B>
	&#148; means an individual or a corporation, firm, limited liability company, partnership, joint venture,
	trust, estate, unincorporated organization, association, government agency or political subdivision thereof or other entity.
<B>
</B>
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX; TEXT-INDENT:4%">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" SIZE="2">

</B>

	Plan of Conversion
</B>
	&#148; has the meaning given such term in
<U>
	Section 14.1
</U>
	.
<B>
</B>
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX; TEXT-INDENT:4%">

<B>
</B>

<B>
	Privately Placed Units
</B>
	&#148; means any Common Units issued for cash or property other than pursuant to a public offering.
<B>
</B>
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX; TEXT-INDENT:4%">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" SIZE="2">
<B>
</B>
	&#147;
<B>
	Pro Rata
</B>
	&#148; means (a)&nbsp;when used with respect to Units or any class thereof, apportioned among all designated
	Units in accordance with their relative Percentage Interests, (b)&nbsp;when used with respect to Partners or Record Holders, apportioned among all Partners or Record Holders in accordance with their relative Percentage Interests, (c)&nbsp;when used
	with respect to holders of Incentive Distribution Rights, apportioned among all holders of Incentive Distribution Rights in accordance with the relative number or percentage of Incentive Distribution Rights held by each such holder and (d)&nbsp;when
	used with respect to Holders who have requested to include Registrable Securities in a Registration Statement pursuant to
<U>
	Section&nbsp;7.12(a)
</U>
	or
<U>
	Section&nbsp;7.12(b)
</U>
	, apportioned among all such Holders in accordance with the relative
	number of Registrable Securities held by each such holder and included in the Notice relating to such request
<B>
	.
</B>
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX; TEXT-INDENT:4%">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" SIZE="2">
<B>
</B>
	&#147;
<B>
	Purchase Date
</B>
	&#148; means the date determined by the General Partner as the date for purchase of all Outstanding
	Limited Partner Interests of a certain class (other than Limited Partner Interests owned by the General Partner and its Affiliates) pursuant to
<U>
	Article XV
</U>
	.
<B>
</B>
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX; TEXT-INDENT:4%">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" SIZE="2">
<B>
</B>
	&#147;
<B>
	Quarter
</B>
	&#148; means, unless the context requires otherwise, a fiscal quarter of the Partnership, or, with respect to the fiscal quarter of the Partnership which includes the Closing
	Date, the portion of such fiscal quarter after the Closing Date.
<B>
</B>
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX; TEXT-INDENT:4%">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" SIZE="2">
<B>
</B>
	&#147;
<B>
	Rate Eligible Holder
</B>
	&#148; means
	a Limited Partner subject to U.S. federal income taxation on the income generated by the Partnership. A Limited Partner that is an entity not subject to U.S. federal income taxation on the income generated by the Partnership shall be deemed a Rate
	Eligible Holder so long as all of the entity&#146;s beneficial owners are subject to such taxation.
<B>
</B>
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX; TEXT-INDENT:4%">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" SIZE="2">
<B>
</B>
	&#147;
<B>
	Recapture Income
</B>
	&#148; means any gain recognized by the Partnership (computed without regard to any adjustment
	required by Section&nbsp;734 or Section&nbsp;743 of the Code) upon the disposition of any property or asset of the Partnership, which gain is characterized as ordinary income because it represents the recapture of deductions previously taken with
	respect to such property or asset.
<B>
</B>
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX">

	&nbsp;

	A-16

<A NAME="eolPage305"></A>
<P STYLE='PAGE-BREAK-BEFORE:ALWAYS'>

<H5 ALIGN="LEFT">
<A HREF="#D164220DS1A_HTM_INDEX">
	Index to Financial Statements
</A>
</H5>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX; TEXT-INDENT:4%">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" SIZE="2">
<B>
</B>
	&#147;
<B>
	Record Date
</B>
	&#148; means the date established by the General Partner or
	otherwise in accordance with this Agreement for determining (a)&nbsp;the identity of the Record Holders entitled to receive notice of, or entitled to
<B>
</B>
	exercise rights in respect of, any lawful action of Limited Partners (including voting) or
	(b)&nbsp;the identity of Record Holders entitled to receive any report or distribution or to participate in any offer.
<B>
</B>
	For the avoidance of doubt, Section 13.6 of the Agreement shall not apply to any Record Date set by the General Partner for
	purposes of determining the identity of Record Holders entitled to receive any report or distribution or participate in any offer.
<B>
</B>
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX; TEXT-INDENT:4%">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" SIZE="2">
<B>
</B>
	&#147;
<B>
	Record Holder
</B>
	&#148; means (a)&nbsp;with respect to any class of Partnership Interests for which a Transfer Agent has been appointed, the Person in whose name a Partnership Interest of
	such class is registered in the records of the Transfer Agent and in the Partnership Register as of the Partnership&#146;s close of business on a particular Business Day or (b)&nbsp;with respect to other classes of Partnership Interests, the Person
	in whose name any such other Partnership Interest is registered in the Partnership Register that the General Partner has caused to be kept as of the Partnership&#146;s close of business on a particular Business Day.
<B>
</B>
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX; TEXT-INDENT:4%">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" SIZE="2">
<B>
</B>
	&#147;
<B>
	Redeemable Interests
</B>
	&#148; means any Partnership Interests for which a redemption notice has been given, and has not
	been withdrawn, pursuant to
<U>
	Section 4.10
</U>
	.
<B>
</B>
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX; TEXT-INDENT:4%">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" SIZE="2">
<I>
</I>
	&#147;
<I>
</I>
<B>
	Registrable Security
</B>
<I>
</I>
	&#148; means
	any Partnership Interest other than the General Partner Interest;
<I>
	provided, however
</I>
	, that any Registrable Security shall cease to be a Registrable Security: (a)&nbsp;at the time a Registration Statement covering such Registrable Security is
	declared effective by the Commission, or otherwise becomes effective under the Securities Act, and such Registrable Security has been sold or disposed of pursuant to such Registration Statement; (b)&nbsp;at the time such Registrable Security may be
	disposed of without restriction pursuant to Rule 144 (or any successor or similar rule or regulation under the Securities Act); (c)&nbsp;when such Registrable Security is held by a Group Member and (d)&nbsp;at the time such Registrable Security has
	been sold in a private transaction in which the transferor&#146;s rights under
<U>
	Section&nbsp;7.12
</U>
	have not been assigned to the transferee of such securities.
<I>
</I>
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX; TEXT-INDENT:4%">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" SIZE="2">
<B>
</B>
	&#147;
<B>
	Registration Statement
</B>
	&#148; has the meaning given such term in
<U>
	Section 7.12(a)
</U>
	.
<B>
</B>
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX; TEXT-INDENT:4%">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" SIZE="2">
<B>
</B>
	&#147;
<B>
	Remaining Net Positive Adjustments
</B>
	&#148; means, as of the end of any taxable period, (a)&nbsp;with respect to the Unitholders holding Common Units or Subordinated Units, the excess of
	(i)&nbsp;the Net Positive Adjustments of the Unitholders holding Common Units or Subordinated Units as of the end of such period over (ii)&nbsp;the sum of those Unitholders&#146; Share of Additional Book Basis Derivative Items for each prior taxable
	period and (b)&nbsp;with respect to the holders of Incentive Distribution Rights, the excess of (i)&nbsp;the Net Positive Adjustments of the holders of Incentive Distribution Rights as of the end of such period over (ii)&nbsp;the sum of the Share of
	Additional Book Basis Derivative Items of the holders of the Incentive Distribution Rights for each prior taxable period.
<B>
</B>
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX; TEXT-INDENT:4%">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" SIZE="2">
<B>
</B>
	&#147;
<B>
	Required Allocations
</B>
	&#148; means any allocation of an item of income, gain, loss or deduction pursuant to
<U>
	Section&nbsp;6.1(d)(i)
</U>
	,
<U>
	Section&nbsp;6.1(d)(ii)
</U>
	,
<U>
	Section&nbsp;6.1(d)(iv)
</U>
	,
<U>
	Section&nbsp;6.1(d)(v)
</U>
	,
<U>
	Section&nbsp;6.1(d)(vi)
</U>
	,
<U>
	Section&nbsp;6.1(d)(vii)
</U>
	or
<U>
	Section 6.1(d)(ix)
</U>
	.
<B>
</B>
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX; TEXT-INDENT:4%">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" SIZE="2">
	&#147;
<B>
	Reset MQD
</B>
	&#148; has the meaning given such term in
<U>
	Section&nbsp;5.10(e)
</U>
	.
</FONT>
</P>

	Share of Additional Book Basis Derivative Items
</B>
	&#148; means in
	connection with any allocation of Additional Book Basis Derivative Items for any taxable period, (a)&nbsp;with respect to the Unitholders holding Common Units or Subordinated Units, the amount that bears the same ratio to such Additional Book Basis
	Derivative Items as the Unitholders&#146; Remaining Net Positive Adjustments as of the end of such taxable period bear to the Aggregate Remaining Net Positive Adjustments as of that time, and (b)&nbsp;with respect to the Partners holding Incentive
	Distribution Rights, the amount that bears the same ratio to such Additional Book Basis Derivative Items as the Remaining Net Positive Adjustments of the Partners holding the Incentive Distribution Rights as of the end of such taxable period bear to
	the Aggregate Remaining Net Positive Adjustments as of that time.
<B>
</B>
</FONT>

<B>
</B>

<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX; TEXT-INDENT:4%">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" SIZE="2">
<B>
</B>
	&#147;
<B>
	Subordinated
	Unit
</B>
	&#148; means a Limited Partner Interest having the rights and obligations specified with respect to Subordinated Units in this Agreement. The term &#147;Subordinated Unit&#148; does not include a Common Unit. A Subordinated Unit that is
	convertible into a Common Unit shall not constitute a Common Unit until such conversion occurs.
<B>
</B>
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX; TEXT-INDENT:4%">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" SIZE="2">
<B>
</B>
	&#147;
<B>
	Subordination Period
</B>
	&#148; means the period commencing on the Closing Date and expiring on the first to occur of the
	following dates:
<B>
</B>
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:6PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX; TEXT-INDENT:4%">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" SIZE="2">
	(a) the first Business Day following the distribution of Available Cash to Partners pursuant to
<U>
	Section&nbsp;6.3(a)
</U>
	in respect of any Quarter beginning with the Quarter ending September&nbsp;30, 2019 in respect of which (i)&nbsp;(A)&nbsp;distributions of Available Cash from Operating Surplus on each of the Outstanding Common Units,
	Subordinated Units and any other Outstanding Units that are senior or equal in right of distribution to the Subordinated Units, in each case with respect to each of the three consecutive, non-overlapping four-Quarter periods immediately preceding
	such date equaled or exceeded the sum of the Minimum Quarterly Distribution on all Outstanding Common Units, Subordinated Units and any other Outstanding Units that are senior or equal in right of distribution to the Subordinated Units, in each case
	in respect of such periods and (B)&nbsp;the Adjusted Operating Surplus for each of the three consecutive, non-overlapping four-Quarter periods immediately preceding such date equaled or exceeded the sum of the Minimum Quarterly Distribution on all
	of the Common Units, Subordinated Units and any other Units that are senior or equal in right of distribution to the Subordinated Units, in each case that were Outstanding during such periods on a Fully Diluted Weighted Average Basis, and
	(ii)&nbsp;there are no Cumulative Common Unit Arrearages.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX; TEXT-INDENT:4%">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" SIZE="2">
	(b) the first Business Day following the distribution of Available
	Cash to Partners pursuant to
<U>
	Section&nbsp;6.3(a)
</U>
	in respect of any Quarter beginning with the Quarter ending September&nbsp;30, 2017 in respect of which (i)&nbsp;(A)&nbsp;distributions of Available Cash from Operating Surplus on each of the
	Outstanding Common Units,
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX">
<FONT SIZE="1">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX" ALIGN="CENTER">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" SIZE="2">
	A-18

<A NAME="eolPage307"></A>

	Table of Contents
</A>
</H5>
<H5 ALIGN="LEFT">
<A HREF="#D164220DS1A_HTM_INDEX">
	Index to Financial Statements
</A>
</H5>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" SIZE="2">
	Subordinated Units and any other Outstanding Units that are senior or equal in right of distribution to the Subordinated Units, in each case with respect to the four-Quarter period immediately
	preceding such date equaled or exceeded 150% of the Minimum Quarterly Distribution on all of the Outstanding Common Units, Subordinated Units and any other Outstanding Units that are senior or equal in right of distribution to the Subordinated
	Units, in each case in respect of such period, and (B)&nbsp;the Adjusted Operating Surplus for the four-Quarter period immediately preceding such date equaled or exceeded 150% of the sum of the Minimum Quarterly Distribution on all of the Common
	Units, Subordinated Units and any other Units that are senior or equal in right of distribution to the Subordinated Units, in each case that were Outstanding during such period on a Fully Diluted Weighted Average Basis, plus the corresponding
	Incentive Distributions and (ii)&nbsp;there are no Cumulative Common Unit Arrearages.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX; TEXT-INDENT:4%">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" SIZE="2">
<B>
</B>
	&#147;
<B>
	Subsidiary
</B>
	&#148;
	means, with respect to any Person, (a)&nbsp;a corporation of which more than 50% of the voting power of shares entitled (without regard to the occurrence of any contingency) to vote in the election of directors or other governing body of such
	corporation is owned, directly or indirectly, at the date of determination, by such Person, by one or more Subsidiaries of such Person or a combination thereof, (b)&nbsp;a partnership (whether general or limited) in which such Person or a Subsidiary
	of such Person is, at the date of determination, a general or limited partner of such partnership, but only if more than 50% of the general partner interests of such partnership is owned, directly or indirectly, at the date of determination, by such
	Person, by one or more Subsidiaries of such Person or a combination thereof or (c)&nbsp;any other Person (other than a corporation or a partnership) in which such Person, one or more Subsidiaries of such Person, or a combination thereof, directly or
	indirectly, at the date of determination, has (i)&nbsp;at least a majority ownership interest or (ii)&nbsp;the power to elect or direct the election of a majority of the directors or other governing body of such Person.
<B>
</B>
</FONT>
</P>

<P STYLE='PAGE-BREAK-BEFORE:ALWAYS'>

</A>
